org.apache.hama.pipes.protocol

Class StreamingProtocol<K1 extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,V1 extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hama.pipes.protocol.BinaryProtocol<K1,V1,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.BytesWritable>
      • org.apache.hama.pipes.protocol.StreamingProtocol<K1,V1>
  • Type Parameters:
    K1 - input key.
    V1 - input value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DownwardProtocol<K1,V1,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text>

    public class StreamingProtocol<K1 extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,V1 extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
extends BinaryProtocol<K1,V1,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.Text,org.apache.hadoop.io.BytesWritable>
    Streaming protocol that inherits from the binary protocol. Basically it writes everything as text to the peer, each command is separated by newlines. To distinguish op-codes (like SET_BSPJOB_CONF) from normal output, we use the surrounds %OP_CODE%=_possible_value.
